title: Commit Message Structure
snippet: Commit message consists of header, body, and footer. Header is mandatory, body is required except for 'docs', footer is optional.

title: Header Format
snippet: Format: <type>(<scope>): <short summary>. Type and summary are mandatory, scope is optional.

title: Types
snippet: Commit types include: build, ci, docs, feat, fix, perf, refactor, test.

title: Scope
snippet: Scope should represent the affected package, such as core, router. Special scopes include packaging, changelog, dev-infra, ngcc.

title: Summary
snippet: The summary should be in imperative present tense, not capitalized, and without a period at the end.

title: Commit Body
snippet: Explains the motivation for the change, using imperative present tense.

title: Commit Footer
snippet: Footer can describe breaking changes, deprecations, and reference GitHub issues or PRs (e.g., Fixes #123).

title: Revert Commits
snippet: Revert commits start with 'revert: ' and reference the commit SHA being reverted, along with an explanation.
